Ratings.comment: Great professor. He goes over every topic. The homework can be long but you have multiple attempts to get a 100%. His tests are open note, so you should do fine! Make sure you practice!

Physics 1250 at OSU Mansfield. Loved him as a prof - the lectures were not mandatory but I gained a lot from them. Lots of online textbook homework problems. A good bit of our final grade came from group work and cooperative labs. Midterms and finals were straightforward (followed material and reviews). Overall 10/10. He is super nice and caring!

Ratings.comment: Interesting guy!

Dr. Pogge is the best professor I've had. I was always excited going to his lectures and it was a fun class that distracted me from all the other stressful things during the week. He made complex subjects, such as finding exoplanets, seem very simple. He can answer almost any astronomy question you have and is a very interesting, caring person.

Dr. Pogge is one of the best professors I've ever had. His lectures keep you engaged for the whole class and he explains complex topics really well. This is one of the few classes that I genuinely enjoyed going to each day.

Dr. Pogge was great. He seemed to really enjoy what he was teaching and it showed in the effort he gave to the class. Very clear with how grades are given. The nature of this course requires a lot of equations and derivations so I would highly recommend getting your hands on a textbook. Overall I'm very pleased with Dr. Pogge's teaching.

Dr Pogge is great! He is very down to earth and is not arrogant when it comes to teaching (since he is a doctor of astronomy), he really seems to love teaching. Easy homework assignments, 2 chances on quizzes each week. I would take this class again and have recommended it to others.

I took Prof Pogge's online astronomy 1101 course and I do not recommend it. The recorded lectures are from 2014 and the TA grades all of the assignments, so he is not even invested in the GE class that he makes so difficult. The exams are weighted much heavier than any other assignments which makes it hard to do well in this *GE* class.

Me pogge is one of the hardest professor at osu. He is passionate about what he teaches but has to many lectures that are difficult to comprehend. Some of his exam questions are just plain difficult for example many questions ask for random specific dates of events. Just wish he did not make exams weighted so heavily. Nice guy sometimes.

Took this class for a physical science GenEd& it ended up being my favorite class this semester. Only homework is weekly open-note quizzes. The final is worth 45% of the entire grade though, took some studying but an A was attainable, especially if you show up to lecture and listen. Prof is an amazing speaker and is super invested. Would recommend

The best. Way overqualified to be teaching a GE, but he still does it because he is so passionate about Astronomy. Attendance is not mandatory but almost everyone still goes to class because he gets super into his lectures and makes them genuinely interesting to listen to. Grade depends heavily on exams but study the slides and you'll be fine.

Prof. Pogge is one of the best. Hes clearly passionate about the material and is excited to teach it. He posts the lecture slides online, but most people still come to class because he is that good. The only downside I would say is that you have to do really well on the midterms and final because there arent a lot of assignments to get points on.
He just amazing!!! Very knowledgeable & passionate about astronomy

You can see how passionate Prof. Pogge is despite it being "just" a GE. Attendance isn't 100% necessary if you're just trying to pass, but there's definitely the opportunity to do better if you regularly attend.

I loved Pogge so much he truly cares about astronomy and is so knowledgeable about it! The class was a little rough, definitely not an easy A GE, but I'm glad I took it. He is kinda goofy in a good way and he posts the lecture powerpoints on Carmen so you don't need to go to class but going to class helps
On-line podcasts have been fantastic.  Thank you so much for sharing!  It has been extremely educational and inspiring.

Prof Pogge is an outstanding prof.  He devotes substantial time to his teaching/students.  Always prepared.  Always super interesting.  And it seems as if he is always available.  Cares about his students.  One of the best.

I LOVE DR. POGGE. I highly recommend his class. He isn't boring t listen to and is a genuinely fair and caring person. The class itself is a bit tough, but bearable. Fair grader. Only two exams made up of 4 questions each and they were very heavily weighted. He does curve and wants you to succeed though. Highly recommend.

Dr. Pogge is one of a kind in my opinion. He is extremely knowledgeable on the topics he discusses and he is clearly very passionate about it as well. You know when tests are and homework is due, and if you want to meet with him, he will find time for that to happen. The grading is fair and the workload is manageable for almost anyone. Must have.

Very passionate about astronomy! He's always willing to help students, but he does expect you to put in the effort. There is a lot of details to remember, especially for a 1101 GE class. Tests can be difficult, but they are curved. Labs can also sometimes be unclear or time consuming.  I took the online section.

Very clear-cut class. Posts lecture slides online so you don't have to attend lecture. Offers extra credit. Very helpful and smart. Tests are a little harder than a typical 1101 course, but easy to get an A with a little studying. Final: a lot of material and cumulative, but not too hard. No textbook!!!!

One of the best lecturers around. In my opinion, the best. I am so glad that he chose to trial the recording of his lectures  for podcast way back  when the internet was young. Astronomy 141, 61 & 62 are superb. It is such a shame we don't have access to more of his material, to more of his mind, his insights, his lectures. He is very good.
Pogge is a genius! Awesome class, tests are a little difficult. If you don't go to class, you have no chance. Fun listening to him talk, he knows so much. Definitely recommend this classPogge.
This man loves astronomy and it shows... if you have a chance, take his class. He will really help you and you can feel his soul is really into teaching. Take his class!
Really great professor
Very good teacher
Take Him! Easy GEC Class!

A great professor! Very into everything he teaches. The classes are not mandatory to go to, but on 4 or more occasions he gave out extra credit for showing up to class. The quizzes are all multiple choice and are not too difficult. Also, his lectures are online and he records each one of them and puts them on iTunes. I absolutely loved this class!

Prof. Pogge is awesome and good at explaining confusing things. No need for book, and all notes/lectures are online. Class is mix of biology and astronomy, and class is pretty interesting. DO NOT BUY BOOK!

Professor Pogge is a great teacher who loves the subject of astronomy. He knows the material well and although the class can be confusing, Pogge is always willing to stop his lectures to answer questions. He also voice records his lectures and puts them on Itunes.
Not an easy class but you will learn a lot from Professor Pogge.  He is very easy to approach and is always willing to help you during his office hours.

Great teacher.  Has a real passion for astronomey and really knows his stuff.  If you could help it, try to get into his class.  At times it can be difficult to comprehend his lectures because he is so smart, but if you really pay attention you will learn alot.

His class is very interesting, and there is alot of material that he covers. You can tell he loves his job, and that is why he is such a great teacher. His midterms are not that bad, and neither was the final. If you show yup to class most of the time you should be fine. Never used the book, and the TA's were very helpful.

a pretty cool guy for an AstroPhysicist. You get used to his whiny voice, cuz he cracks jokes a lot. VERY VERY helpful, puts lectures up on podcast so you can download them, notes are online, never mentioned the textbook. Tests are kinda difficult though, 5 HW, 5 Quizes, no midterm.
killer course
awesome. do not get anybody else for astronomy. he's the man

This guy does love astronomy, you can tell by the way he lectures. Only fault was office hours. I tried to go several times and he was never there, he would always show up late and then seem to get agitated if I asked too many questions.
Very fair grader.  Highly energetic and ambitous about providing good-quality info.  I enjoyed his philosophical connections to the universe.
Good teacher. Teaches with enthusiasm and makes the material interesting. Fair tests with fair grading. Recommended.

50 M.C. exam every other week. If you think you will enjoy that, & taking a very content rich 100 level GEC, take this guy.  He is excited about his material, but talks really fast. If you have a photographic memory, you're all set. I had to study a lot & still only ended up with a B, & it took too much time away from my core/major courses.

I just finished off my first quarter with him. The lectures were good and through, however the quizzes, which there are 4 of, are extremely difficult and 50 questions each. For the final we were told to study the quizzes. After taking that final today. I think I'm going to be taking 161 again. He is a great guy, exetremly understanding, and helpful

Dr. Pogge is great. He is extremely intelligant but not in a snobby way. His lectures were fun and he had neat demonstrations. The tests are not easy but that is because they are set up by the department, not the individual teacher.
Great Prof!  I really like it when they seem to love what they are teaching and Prof Pogge is one of those!  Not to mention he builds a lot of the equipment that goes on OSU's telescopes!

He is GREAT!!! He is a very good teacher, and he is very good at explaining difficult facts. He is also very helpful. I didn't skip even one class, because it was my favorite, thanks to him. He has a good sense of humor, too. I learned a lot from him, and he is still my favorite professor. And he is very cute to me. :)

He is great! He is one of the few teachers that I have had that I have really enjoyed coming to class to listen to. Even if you don't like lectures the demonstrations that he does in class for certain topics are great.. flying donuts on string to represents gravity/ velocity. NICE!

Awesome class! I'd reccomend him to anyone. He is enthusiastic and always willing to help. Don't buy the book because you do not need it at all. Going to lecture helps a lot because he lectures in a way that will clear up any confusion you have. First class in all of college where I came out of it feeling like I really learned a lot!
This guy is bananas, B-A-N-A-N-A-S.  He was sweet and extremely helpful.  Go to class and keep up with lecture notes.  Awesome teacher.  Best I've had in college so far.

This guy is amazing!  Prolly the best teacher I have ever had here.  He knows what he is talking about and answers questions very well.  He is always willing to help at office hours too and is an all around cool guy.  No book needed, just go to lecture and keep up with his printed out notes.

I love this man!!  He does a great job and is so passionate.  He's just adorable.  Take his class.  You won't regret it.  No need to buy the book.  Just make sure you go to the classes.  He explains a lot there.
Excellent Professor! A must take class for anyone interested in Astronomy. The "Indiana Jones" of Astronomy. Don't need the book to get an A!
No reading, class notes are all online, if you go to class you should get an A or B

Ratings.comment: Very easy class, with plenty of extra credit. You basically just have to pay attention to the lecture and PowerPoint. Not a 5 star cause the lectures aren't always the most interesting, but if you're interested in the subject then you would find them more interesting. Midterms and the final make up 75% of your grade so be careful with those tests.

Easily one of my favorite professors at Ohio State, such a knowledgeable, nice, and funny person! As long as you pay attention to lectures you should be all good for taking the quizzes in class that are also very similar to study guides given. If you get a chance, take a GE with Prof. Pinsonneault!
Very unorganized, class wouldn't be that hard if it weren't for poor instruction.

He is one of my favorite professors as he's really so nice and funny. This class has 3 midterms and a final which are straight to the point and exactly like the study guide. There's also mini quizzes every friday which are really easy if you pay attention in class . He also has review sessions before the test that I recommend going to.
Gives review sessions, is approachable, study guides before exams. Questions are from guides

Marc is really passionate about Astronomy. Hands out a copy of his powerpoint in the beginning of every class so you have a copy of the class notes, so definitely attend class. Tried a new grading scale for my class that I wasn't a big fan of.
Very interesting class, enthusiastic, easy to pass as long as you pay attention. No textbook required. Didn't need to study much and got an A-. would definitely recommend.
The class itself is a lot of memorization in the beginning and then shifts to application of the concepts.  He clearly knows his stuff and enjoys talking about it.  Great for a GE

learning about astronomy is cool and hard because of the complex reasonings behind them. He really wants you to understand the concepts and try hard for us to do so. he makes the class very interesting. i would 100% take him again
Harder than what everyone says, maybe because Ohio state is on Semesters now

Worst homework grading ever. Homeworks are graded very harshly and hurt your grade instead of helping it. Quizes and exams are ridiculously hard. Exams are short answer and they look for a very specific answer or you're not passing.

It's not exactly an easy A, especially if you don't go everyday.  If you go he hands out his notes prior to lecture so you don't have to pay attention, but it's a pain to go 5 days a week at 8:30 am.  Drops lowest quiz score.
I would give him a B

Very nice and enthusiastic guy! He loves what he is doing and is willing to help you clarify things, too. The final was much harder than quizzes. Make sure you study a lot! Overall, I highly recommend Marc!

Best teacher I have had at OSU to date.  Study slides and study guides and you will do well on quizzes.  Drops lowest quiz grade.  Final is difficult and comprehensive.  Curves grades!  Very passionate, helpful teacher.  Great teacher--few and far in between at such a large university that OSU is

Yea, he is definielty not that easy.  His quizzes are very detailed and if you don't study his slides to a "t" you will not do well.  There are only 2 quizzes and a midterm and a final and some homework.  No dropping of grades.  He does curve but only the lower end of the curve which sucks.  He's very particular and can se through **** answers

Not as easy as every one is saying. I went to class basically everyday minus a few sick days and read all the material. I got c+ on my exam because he expects A LOT of detail when answering questions. He is willing to help clarify. Just not that easy when it comes to tests and grading

Great professor, you have a 30 question test every other Friday over the previous 2 weeks material and you drop your lowest one.  Easy hw, I studied an hour before each test and went to class and got a B.  You're given 6 questions from each quiz on the final and you answer 4 of your choice.  Not a bad class for your science GEC.  Take Marc.

Very helpful and enlightening.  While dorky at times, you can tell he is passionate about astronomy and that he knows a great deal about the subject which he is willing to share with everyone.  Very helpful in times of tests and homework and willing to answer any question one has in great detail.  Strongly recommmend.

He is crazy and funny.  He is kind of dorky, but you can tell he loves his subject, and loves teaching.  He is very helpful.  Offers study sessions before each test and goes over exactly what material will be on the test.  Study guides are very helpful.  Definately reccomend this professor.

Ratings.comment:
He's actually a great guy. Relatable, and creates a relaxed yet productive learning environment. Will occasionally ask you (or your table) to participate in front-of-the-classroom activities, but they usually aren't too bad. Can be a little hard to understand at times.

You might spot him at the RPAC every now and then!

I enjoyed taking astronomy. It was a very straightforward class and I learned a lot. Professor Wang is kind and the lectures were very interesting. I would definitely take another astronomy class with Professor Wang!

I had Dr. Wang for 2141 and loved it! It was pretty easy overall, there were only a few short homework assignments. Grades are mostly based on exam scores but are pretty easy if you pay attention in lecture. Dr. Wang loves his subject and it really comes through in his lectures--if you like astronomy, I would definitely recommend this class.

I actually take ASTRON 2141

Ji is an amazing person. He is very enthusiastic in the lectures and well prepared. The exams are not too difficult and easily to get good grades!

Ji is a really chill and good professor, however he should probably not teach this class as an intro. It's pretty difficult but if you are really passionate then you will love the class and teacher. It is test heavy and they are hard.

Ji is a great guy and is always enthusiastic about his lectures. They are often long and can be drawn out, but theyre very palatable. I would easily recommend taking this class if youre interested in a cool astronomy class. If you want to learn, you will. Just be aware that there arent many assignments so grade depends on your exam scores mainly

Overall this class doesn't require a lot of work out of class as there is. only one assigned homework, but unfortunately, that has a negative impact on your grade. The grades in this class are entirely based on exams, which I feel you are not properly prepared for through lectures.
Group projects and test there is no homework

Not to many grades so make sure to study and get good grades on exams because that will really determine your final. Loves poster projects. Slightly boring but not a bad lecturer. Rarely gives homework. No mandatory readings. Loves what he does and is evident by the way he teaches.
He is really passionate about the topics he teaches and is available to answer any questions you may have.
Class is graded on group projects and exams. There is no homework in the class which was really nice. If you are attentive in the lectures youll do fine on the exams.
super nice professor that really cares about his students

Ji is knowledgeable and very passionate. But, he should not be teaching level 1000 courses. His material excels past a general education class. I would not recommend taking a general education course with hun. That being said he is the nicest professor Ive ever met. He is funny and so kind. Youll struggle if youre not passionate about the topic.

Test heavy course. Ji is a nice guy but this class is way too hard for a 1000 level course. If you aren't science brained, I don't recommend this class. Test lectures are pretty straight forward but the tests go into detail. Way too in depth in my opinion. Again, Ji is super nice and I like him as a person. This course just isn't my cup of tea!

I have never been in a class where the students loved a professor as much as they loved Ji!You have to attend lectures for participation to answer occasional polls just to make sure you're tuned in, but if you miss a few classes, it won't hurt your grade. It's a test-heavy class, but he's very accommodating. I highly recommend Ji - he's the best!
Knows what he is talking about, very straightforward class, very few assignments, and tests so study hard

Professor Wang is a teacher who really cares about his and the stresses they go through especially during this time we are in. This was my least stressful and one of the most enjoyable classes as well. Im glad I took his class.
He's a great professor! Exams matter a lot because those are most of the only grades you receive, but interesting and easy to follow!

One of my favorite professors I've ever had at OSU. He is super nice and caring. He took our concerns and changed some things to help with people's grades, like adding some easy homework grades and changing the final exam. Lectures are mandatory but there's little assignments so it doesn't take up much of your time. He's the best!

Ji is a great professor and he tries to meet the students need. Also, he understands students when they are going through stress or anything like that so he is lenient but it is important to go to class as class accounts for a big part of your grade. Also, it is important to study for the tests as tests account for about 60% of the grade.
Great professor. He gives little to no homework. Class is interesting

I loved his class. There are 5 homework assignments and one project that is very simple. He also has three exams. He also does participation grade which is just showing up to class. I think this a great and interesting class to get a science GE at OSU.

The class was not at all difficult. The lectures and powerpoints were posted after class, so that allowed me to go back and take additional notes. The exams were very straightforward as they were content from the lecture and PowerPoint. The class is very chill with one assignment per week and the instructor is very much interested in his teaching.

Really cares about the students. As long as you show up to lectures you should be prepared enough for the exams. Im not a science kid but still found class material easy to understand and fairly interesting.
Good job
Very good and personable professor. Adapted the class to accommodate those who were struggling during the pandemic.
Ji is a great professor. He really listens to students needs, has a good sense of humor and loves what he teaches. He can make class interesting and fun.
Ji genuinely cares about his students, and makes the class as interesting as possible for even the lowest common denominator.
Ji is the nicest professor I've had. He makes it easy to learn the material. There aren't a lot of grades so missing an assignment could hurt but they're all really easy.
Very nice guy, restructured the grading scheme and the final to help us out at the end of the year. Attendance at lectures were mandatory but only a couple easy assignments all year, and no homework.

Ji is a real G. Class was online, and despite the course being a general education requirement already, he was super accommodating and gave pretty interesting lectures! Would definitely recommend it. The workload is maybe a 5/10 difficult wise- basically the same as any brain-dump memorization course.
Jis astronomy class is fun and not too difficult, plus you can tell he really cares. Absolutely would take one of his other classes.
Chill professor who listens to the students' concerns. Talks a little fast but only because there is so much information to be said, otherwise, everything is on the slides provided.
Ji Wang is amazing
Jj is amazing, definitely would take his class again! He really helps his students and want to provide less stress.

Ji made it very obvious that the class shouldnt be stressful. He worked with students and made changes to help those who struggled initially by providing more study materials and adding more homework assignments. His humor and somewhat interesting content were bonuses.
Good teacher
It was a lot of fun and I learned a lot. The exams were not too hard if you did a bit of studying beforehand.

Ji is a great professor who is very accommodating to his students. The class is very lecture heavy, but as long as you take good notes and study for the exams you will get an A. He also gives very helpful study guides to review before exams.

Professor Wang was very accommodating to our requests regarding course changes because of covid. He tweaked our final exam to cover less material and even lowered its % of our final grade. He was also very helpful if you needed extra help or directions outside of lecture. Would definitely recommend!

Prof Wang is a very good professor who cares about the material. I took this. class as a GE expecting it to be easy, however it was not as easy as I thought. I still enjoyed the class as Prof. Wang was genuinely interested in the topic. Overall, Prof. Wang cares about the students and is passionate about the material, but it is very test heavy.

Dr. Wang is a good professor however some of his material can be confusing. Its hard to keep track of his lecture slides at times. This class isnt as easy as I expected but hes still a good professor who cares about the material. The course is dependent on the tests, so you have to do really well on the exams and study a lot to get an A.

If you're at all interested in astronomy it will barely feel like a class because it is so fascinating. Ji is a great professor and extremely knowledgeable on the information. He can go quickly through the slides and it can be a lot of information at times, but tests are very general and include questions from the online practice quizzes.

He cares but the material is presented so incredibly poorly, the slides are not well made, and the content is so thick that it is pretty hard to know what will be on the test, even with the practice exams he gives.

super chill professor - he makes the class very fun and engaging. Contents are a bit hard for me because I'm not a science student and know nothing about the material at the beginning. There are two midterms and a final - a lot to memorize and have to study hard for them. Overall the class is interesting!

Ji does his best to be engaging with the class material. He is very passionate about the subject and is always smiling and adding jokes to lectures. Only issue is that he flies through the lectures so you can't take the notes until he posts the slides later. Class is graded by two midterms and one final, so you have to do well on all 3 for an A.

The class is interesting to begin with, and Ji made it even better. For some reason he just cracks me up during the lectures, which are engaging and fun. Tests are very easy. I strongly recommend doing the practice tests that he makes ;). This was easily my favorite class of the semester.
Ji is a cool guy, lectures aren't hard to pay attention to. Tests are pretty easy and he gives practice tests that are very similar to the real thing.
Solid prof, ain't a cake-walk, but it's not impossibly hard.

I took this class mainly as a GE and I heard it was easy. Well it's not. Not only was Ji a new professor, he did not know how to use Carmen or follow his own syllabus. On the first day of class he was very clear that no notes of any kind are allowed on the test. Little do you know, on the second exam a student tells us that we are allowed to.

Ratings.comment: Had him for 2141. He's fine. The class is probably harder than a GE needs to be. My only issue is that I had him for “life in the universe” and we just did not ever learn about life in the universe. He just taught it as a general intro astronomy class. 90% of the content overlaps with 2140 (which I already took)

This guy is NOT good. He rambles during lecture in a mumbly-voice that's hard to understand unless you're sitting in the front of the classroom. His exam questions are strangely worded and convoluted. He tries to trick you during exams. Overall, terrible. Steer clear.

Other reviews seem extremely harsh. Prof Pradhan is a very knowledgeable lecturer. His tests are composed of questions pulled directly from his lecture slides, so, if you study those, you will be well prepared. He also gives students a lot of opportunities to ask questions when confused, and then helps clear up concepts. Overall, a great professor!

Professor Pradhan is obviously smart. However, his Astronomy 1140 course is probably not the GE you're looking for. His curving is quite frustrating. He'll say "the curve for quiz 2 is +5%," but then your test score goes down. It's not actually 5%--he just moved the average up 5% and fit a semi-normal distribution. Annoying for a GE.
Only grades were tests that he did not prepare you for.
Better than his ratings imply. Attendance isnt mandatory but very helpful. If you go to lectures and study for the exams youll get a good grade.
If youre about to take a class with him switch immediately.

I'll keep it short and sweet. Do not take this class for an easy GE fulfillment. I had to work the hardest for this class, which was unreasonably hard for a non-major intro GE class. Professor Pradhan is too smart to teach this. Take a different class. For the love of god, take a different class if you're expecting an easy GE class.

He rambles a lot during lectures, making all of his lecture (which is the entire class) extremely boring. Furthermore, none of the of notes you take during class or study guides he provides or slides he offers can prepare for the tests. You are kind of screwed considering tests determine your grade.

Very hard GE, grade based on 4 exams, lowest one dropped and a final which is 40% of your grade. I've been interested in astronomy my entire life, but even I found this class to be excruciatingly boring. The lectures aren't that important to attend if you just study the slides on your own time.

This class left me with nothing but confusion, as Professor Pradhan in my opinon is too smart to teach a GE course. My main complaint about the course is that the study guides did not correlate to what was on the exams , and the exams were the ONLY thing that counted towards your grade.

do NOT take this class. This class taught me nothing but how to stress more and the professor was the worst I have ever had and doesn't care at all about his students success. I have studied for multiple hours and have been let down by my horrific grades. This class is an outrage to society and I hope the science department fix this class.

So here's the thing. Professor Pradhan is very intelligent, and is very experienced in the astronomy realm. I took this for my physical science GE and it's the hardest class i've taken at OSU so far. The class consists of 4 midterms (drop lowest) and one final, that's it. You must work very hard to earn a good grade in this class.

Do NOT take his classes if you need easy credit. I repeat, do NOT take his classes. Ive studied for his tests, oh yes I have. Hours and hours, and I still get D minuses on all of them. This professor is too smart to teach a 1000 class. Its so hard and not worth taking. Please head this warning. Do NOT take his classes.

Very boring teacher. 4 tests, he drops the lowest one, and a final exam. Curves the first test only. Gives an extra credit assignment at the end of the semester where you can earn 10% back on each test. Entered the final exam with a 101%. You have to study a ton for the tests to get a good grade. Pay attention in lectures, no need for the book.

Very nice and caring guy, but the class overall is fairly difficult. Lectures are pointless because you can just look at slides he provides on own time. 4 midterms, 3 count for grade (60%), plus final (40%). If you work very hard you just might get a B. For a GE is pretty difficult.

This class wasn't the hardest thing in the world but it could get stressful. His lectures are super boring as he just teaches from the slides. There are 4 midterms and a final, and the lowest midterm is dropped. He curves each exam and 90-100 is an A. Grading is lenient but his tests were hard as the material was not what I studied for.

Overall, I thought this was an easy class but others did not. If you study the material from lectures and the study guide Professor Pradhan gives you, you will get As on all the exams. There are 4 midterms (drop the lowest) and one final in the class. No other grades. Also, the textbook is a waste of money because its not needed.

Very very bad professor. Too smart to teach a class. Makes it hard on his students by not using Carmen. The study guide is 20% of what is on the exams. I would take any class at Ohio State over his class.

Cannot stress enough how much I hated this class. He gave us four midterms, one was the last class before the final. He consistently ridiculed us for not paying attention to the "astronomy news" and his lectures were unbelievably boring. You really do need to study for his exams. Don't try going to his office hours, either, he doesn't show up.

Prof. Pradhan's class wasn't particularly hard-- his lectures were just terribly long and often unimportant. Every exam you could study for off his study guide that he creates and get at least an 80%. Either read the text or go to class, do not do both. He is a very smart individual with high expectations for his students.

What I read on here scared me as a first year freshman about this class, but it was so easy. Maybe because it was my first year and I went to every class and took good notes but the test were verbatim from the lectures. Would speed through the test even though some people struggled. All memorization.

Worst teacher of all time. I am not joking when I say less than half of what he teaches/on the study guide ends up on the tests. You go to his lecture twice a week and he just rambles about nothing that he'll actually test you on. He's one of those guys who is just too smart to teach. Your GPA will suffer. Definitely avoid any class with this man.

This was the hardest class I've  taken. Before the first class he says his tests are easy, DON'T LISTEN, the average grade was around a 50% but he does drop the lowest. Take any other physical science credit. He was a nice guy but the tests were way too hard. I had a 4.0 until this class. I had to study about 20 hours for exams and still got a B+.
For a gen-ed, the class is unnecessarily hard. It is lecture heavy and the quizzes are composed of specific details that he barely discusses in class.

Lectures are just powerpoints every single class which are accessible so no real need to go every day.  4 midterms drop the lowest one and then a big final are all of your grades.  Even though attendance not mandatory, I still went to every single one and the tests all have a ton of questions that are asking you about things he never even mentions
Test are all multiple choice. No homework at all. Very interesting class overall.

If your looking for an easy ge class, do not take this one. Exams are very lecture heavy so be prepared to write down everything he says. Slightly thick accent, tends to ramble. He does curve, but if averages are higher than he expects he will make tests harder throughout course.

Anil is very smart and is enthralled by astronomy. Accent is not difficult to decipher at all. Make sure to attend every lecture because he goes into detail every lecture. Only graded by 3 quizzes and final, but he uses a more lenient grading scale and curves grades.
Kinda hard but dope class.

NOOOO, don't do it if you're thinking about taking 1143. Very hard to understand and does not understand the concept of an organized outline for a "lecture", basically just meant talking about what he found interesting, trying to explain things  along the way. Homework graded on accuracy based on things not yet gone over in class.

He is very hard to understand not only because of a slight accent, but because he is "too smart" to teach a bunch of undergraduate college students looking to fulfill a GE requirement. Would not recommend his class. His lectures put me to sleep more than once.
Almost never went to this class. All lectures slides were online, test were multiple choice. Very easy

This was my least favorite class/teacher that I have had at Ohio State. Anil is VERY smart-but too smart to teach. You almost have to go into this intro class with a lot of previous knowledge. Exams and quizzes are really hard (only grades are 4 quizzes midterm and a final). He curves grades and you don't need textbook. Attendance not required.

Couldn't stand the class. He is a smart dude but can't simplify the material at all. Asking questions doesn't help, his accent is troublesome. Exams are HARD. Once lectured us on material from one of the exams 10 minutes after we finished it. I recommend NOT taking his classes.
Terrible teacher. So boring. I never knew what he was talking about and he didn't help students at all. DONT take a class with him

The prof knows his stuff. he will help after class with questions-prob is hes so smart his help isnt really help. the tests are crazy hard and his low monotone voice makes it hard to hear-even if you could understand him learning anything is hard cos this intro class is far from intro level!! take a dif GEC!! i know im failing and i seriously tried

This guy is pretty ridiculous for a beginner class, but then again how can you dumb anything astronomy related down if your a Atomic, Molecular, Optical, & Plasma Physics teacher? Tests were hard and class average was very low, oh yea accent doesnt help either.
Fantastic professor; learnt a lot but need to pay attention. Wanted to take other courses from him but was not teaching that year.

Class was extremely boring. When he explained concepts he kept correcting himself and 20 minutes later you were more confused than before. The only reason I did well was because I read the book and he curves well. But he has to because class averages on the quizzes were 55-60%!

The comments about his speech are true - a few quirks, but he's still understandable. Lecture is incredibly boring and you could easily get by with just the book and notes online. (I just go to class because it takes less time.) Overall, the quizes are easy but there are always a few tricky questions or something that he didn't cover in lecture.

Haha, I agree with the previous comment -- Pradhan really does elongate his vowels. He is not difficult to understand though, despite the accent. I think lecture is pretty boring the majority of the time, but he covers most of what is on the quizzes. He doesn't always seem very approachable, but he does answer questions.

Prof. Pradhan is teaching a low-level class and he knows it. His accent isn't too bad, but he does have an amusing quirk where he elongates his vowels like he's having mini-seizures. He also has a tendency to forget he's teaching in a large lecture hall, thus using a small overhead projector. He puts the PPT's online, so class is optional.

This is one of those classes where you can either go to lecture or buy the book, but you dont need to do both.  I bought the book, never went to class, and had no problem getting a solid B.  Didn't take too much effort, and he's actually a nice guy.
terrible teacher... can't understand him, he doesnt talk about anything on the tests.. i went to every class am an honors student and still got a C
There is no need to a text book if you go to Lecture.  The tests are easy multiple choice questions, just a few that make you think.  Nice guy to talk to if you have any problems.
Pretty dry, but he makes the material clear and tells you exactly what you need to know for the tests.  I didn't buy the book, just went from his notes and I had no problems getting an A.
Good professor, just go to the lectures, READ THE BOOK! Tests are all multiple choice, really hard not to get an A when you have a 13 point grade curve
Very easy material, yet, the tests were very hard and the book didn't help.
Don't bother buying the textbook, you can get through just fine with his notes.  Curves well but has a heavy accent and tends to be on the dry side.  Go to class, take notes and you should be fine.
The tests were very hard.  I would go to class and it would just confuse me even more.  It's such basic material but he made it more difficult.

Ratings.comment: A professor worthy of selection. The only drawback is that the writing on the board is poor.
Dr. Kochanek is a valuable professor. Choose him, and you will never regret!
Dr. Kochanek is smart. He expresses his knowledge very well. The only drawback is his awful handwriting.
Don't take him!! Really smart but doesn't know how to break topics down and explain them well. Homeworks are hard and he's not helpful.

Prof. Kochanek is a great astronomer, but definitely avoid having him as a professor if at all possible. His notes are a mess and the lectures are draining and hard to follow. Doesn't listen to student feedback. Homework and exam questions seem way above the level of the textbook. Sometimes the TA didn't even know how to do the problems.
Literally take a different professor if you have a choice. You have been warned

an intelligent person I wish he had more organized lectures and notes The prof needs to understood the gap of knowledge between himself and students. Many students cannot keep up with his lectures and learn better from books. I do read books but I believe that lectures should also be efficient for students to review or learn better

I really enjoyed Professor Kochanek! Although sometimes the lectures were a bit boring, they almost always ended early. Theres only 4 quizzes and a final, and there are no other grades so its important to know the material but most of it is interesting. Would definitely recommend his class!

Your grade in this class consists of four 'quizzes' (i.e. midterms) and a final, and your lowest quiz grade is dropped. They aren't particularly hard if you pay attention in lecture, and the averages reflect that (80%ish). Very interesting class. If you have a decent background in physics, you'll do just fine. Also, Mr. K wears a lot of turtlenecks

This a a hard class, but you will learn a lot if you attend regularly. It isn't an easy A, but I came away with a great love of Astronomy due to Dr. Kochanek. You can tell he really knows his stuff and enjoys teaching. Class is 4 midterms (one dropped) and one final exam that wasn't difficult.

The class gets pretty in depth but it will help you gain an amazing perspective on the way the universe works. Not the easiest grade but if you have an interest in the universe and would like a class that you'll take knowledge from, this is one of them. His assistants are a huge help also.

Like everyone else is saying, this is way to much work for a GEC! TAKE A DIFFERENT CLASS! Our grade is from 3 midterms and a final. That's it. Even if you have a slight interest in astronomy, this class is not for you. When I read this website as I was scheduling, I thought, I can still do well in this class. It won't be bad. WRONG. Spare yourself.

Three quizzes and a final, and he doesn't curve the class.  I'm not sure if he realizes 95% of the students taking this class was because it was an all-lecture science class. Way too difficult/detailed for a GEC and brought down my GPA. DON'T TAKE
Awful class. Boring and confusing. Not even that much about black holes. I hated every moment of it.

TURTLENECKS (you'll understand). Class was easy if you review all of the slides he provides on Carmen for the tests and the practice quiz questions are the same on the tests also. Don't wait until the last minute to review because there's a lot of info. Lectures are sometimes boring, but there are details he adds that aren't on the slides sometime

Not a bad class. Class is everyday which can get old, but notes are online. Make sure to get the practice quizzes and use previous quizzes for the exam, which helps a lot. If you go to class once and a while and review the material well before quizzes, you should do well.

This class meets M-F and while attendance isn't mandatory, just picture how much material is covered. Gives 4 "quizzes" (40? & 100 points each) and a final, though you can drop 1 quiz grade. Thank god he puts slides online or I would have failed because I couldn't pay attention. Too detailed for a GEC and not at all worth the effort. Don't take.

The guy is funny and interesting but it was hard to go to class every single day when the notes were online. The textbook is useless, use the notes instead. The first quiz questions are almost exactly the questions he gives you on the study guide and the final questions are mostly the questions he gives you on the four quizzes.

I thought he was a really interesting professor. He was hilarious, in kind of a nerdy way. If you made a point of attending class every day and reading the book when you were supposed to, the class is not hard at all.

Good class. Professor taught somewhat difficult subject in ways that were easy to understand. Clearly loves astronomy. 4 quizzes were somewhat tough, but you get to drop one, and final consisted of questions straight from quizzes.

typical science nerd, but he was an interesting guy and occasionally funny. material was interesting, but hard! study his powerpoints a lot and you shouldnt do too bad on the quizzes and he curves them!

You have to go to class everyday. You will FALL ASLEEP in class EVERYDAY. The material is interesting but there are too many weird phrases such as "microt" and "spectroscopy" and so on. He seems to be stuck in the early 70's...has these huge glasses and always wears turtlenecks. He also sweats a ton. Weird guy, not the best teacher.

Really interesting material. The quizzes are difficult though. Different material than what he teaches. Always study the sample quizzes he gives you. Kochanek himself is pretty quirky, but not a bad professor.

Basically this is a tough class. I took it because it looked really interesting, but its a load of work. Study the text book hard- to understand the material- as tests are very little basedon his notes online, mostly on understanding difficult concepts, i had to put ina lot of hours reading the book-- worth it overall, because you learn loads

I learned soo much in this class! I can't understand how someone could find this class boring. Everyday he comes in with cool space pictures and the current astronomy news. He makes the subject come alive! The two midterms and final were challenging, but as long as you study and pay attention in class, you will be well off. I reccomend this class!
This class is hard, boring and tedious.
dear god this class was boring..very hard too, lots of studying.  He gives no review sheets, and the cumulative final requires gobs of studying...AVOID
Seriously....I don't think there was a single class period where, at some point, I did NOT fall asleep.

After almost 4 years as a student here, I have had my share of****ty ass teachers.  This teacher, however, is one of the best I have ever had.  His lectures were very informative and intersting.  He went out of his way to answer every questions that I submitted via email with a thorough explaination.  I would take his class anyday.

His class was boring, and he had no effective method of keeping students interested in the class. The only people who were remotely interested in this class were the ones who deliberately made themselves pay attention---anyone who said this class was worthwhile was kidding themselves.
You could tell he really loved to teach. I would reccomend this course to anybody with the slightest bit of interest in Astronomy. Good Guy, always answers our questions in class and does fun labs
very monotone, hard to stay awake in class, but at least he knows what he's talking about.  make sure to study notes and you'll be fine
exam wasnt bad, class is boring, but could do much worse.
If this man were any more boring he'd be dangerous....or in an asylum.

Funny and interesting guy but somehow the lectures were rather boring. Only one big assignment per week, but in a group each took about 3 hours which I think is fair. Take home exams and final that were exactly like assignments. Some TA's were grading unfairly at the start of the semester, so he made a shared rubric and regraded.

Not an easy GE. Grading consists exclusively of tests. He doesn't use Carmen (the virtual grading book OSU uses) so its nearly impossible to know your grade during the year. He does curve the midterms, and you are allowed one help sheet to write info. Overall a very boring class that consists only of lectures.

Dont take this professor for Astronomy 1140. The class is extremely dry and only grades are tests. Only was to study is take notes on the lectures which dont always answer all the questions on the tests. If you love yourself then take any other astronomy class besides this one.

Absolutely the most difficult class I have ever taken. For being a straight A student, it is extremely frustrating to do so poorly in his class. He doesn't explain things well and often times when he tries to clarify it seems like a circular definition. Slides are straight forward, but not very helpful for his exams.
Impossible to get a good grade or to understand his accent. Doesn't explain any concepts and the test are not on anything he covers. GPA killer for such a low level course

Professors who run their class like Stanek should be required to thoroughly overhaul their courses. He gives students long lectures and corresponding power points to study from and no other help is given. It's impossible for students to fuly grasp the material if they cant learn on their own from a book or practice problems. Fun guy, but don't take

Has an accent and is sometimes slightly difficult to understand. There are no quizzes or homework so your grade depends on the 4 tests. The lectures are long and boring. You will be able to pass the class as long as you take the notes on the slide and pay attention when he gives you examples or theoretical explanations.

Ratings.comment: I love her so much. She is so kind, understanding, & passionate about what she teaches. Amazing professor who is always willing to explain things & listen to her students.

Dr. Lopez is an awesome professor. Her lectures during the online semester were interactive and she makes reviewing them really easy, so you don't really need to take notes during the lectures. She cares about students. Her cats are adorable too; the long and short of it is that OSU and the astro department are lucky to have a gem like Dr. Lopez.

Just an overall great teacher who's passionate about her material and teaching her students! Lectures are super easy to follow, and slides are available after class for reference. Highly Highly recommend taking a class with her!
She's really nice.
Fun lectures and easy to prepare for midterms

Attendance isnt mandatory, so I never went except for the days hw was due. The lectures were boring-- she just read off the slides, and went too fast. No textbook. Drops 1 exam, and the exams arent cumulative, so I did not bother to learn the last 1/4 of the material. I crammed the day before each exam and did OK. She's nice but I hated her class
Pretty much just lecture and exams. Some HW assignments before exams, but you have several days and they're really easy. Great lecturer and really likes the stuff

Gives one homework assignment per quiz, 3 quizzes/3 assignments. Only puts math in the homework and has review sessions to go through the homework/math step by step if you need it and review sessions that cover almost exactly what is on the quiz.

Professor Lopez is a really sweet lady. She does tend to only lecture with slides, but if you're interested in astronomy it's interesting regardless. I'm a non-STEM major and I found the class to be easy, fun, and really cool. Attendance is non-mandatory and she's pretty flexible if you need to take your final early/late.

Her lectures were often repetitive and disorganized. Prof. Lopez's lectures weren't very engaging, & she seemed to have difficulty breaking large concepts  into simple terms for us non-STEM majors taking the class for GE credit. I found myself working very hard to learn the material even after going attending lecture & going to review sessions.s

Professor Lopez is a super nice lady. All lecture notes are put online and lectures are not mandatory so as long as you follow with the lecture slides before quizzes you will be fine. Super easy A and you get to learn about some pretty interesting stuff along the way if you are interested in this kind of stuff.
Prof Lopez is a very caring lady who will always help you in need. she doesn't give  alot homework and calculating. The test is about if you understand the material or not.

She seems well intentioned but her lectures are very confusing. In a previous Astronomy class my professor organized his lectures much better. He also was better at simplifying the material for non-majors. I think Laura has a difficult time putting the information in simpler terms for non-majors to understand. She tries, but isn't great at teaching

Ratings.comment: Great guy, cares about his students, plenty of opportunities to get help outside of class. Its refreshing having a professor who loves what they teach and is good at making tough concepts easy. People who treated his class like a GE(which it was) got a bad grade but I found it easy bec I went to every lecture. Best class Ive taken in college so far

Please do not take this class unless you are very interested in physics and science beforehand. The professor is great, but the homework sometimes includes problems that were never mentioned in class and you are sometimes given little framework off of which to base your answers.

Great teacher. The class is kind of hard but probably the most interesting stuff you'll ever learn. Read the book, do the homeworks, and he has reviews before tests that are EXTREMELY helpful. Do all of that and you'll do great. Never been more interested in a topic in my life after taking this class. Ended up with an A-

this class has hard concepts for a GEC the assignments take a long time and the tests are extremely hard.  do not take this class as a GEC unless you enjoy science greatly and are super interested in the topic.  As far as a teacher he knows what he is talking about and the class is pretty interesting.  Overall way too hard for a GEC

I was really hesitant about this class just from the previous comments, but I went to class, read the book, got help from the homework and got an A which is saying a lot since I'm pretty bad a science. SO interesting. If you do the work, it's worth taking.

Lectures not mandatory to attend.  But AVOID this class if you can. This professor says what is on the lecture notes he post on his website. Yet his homework is challenging as hardly any of the problems are from the notes. Way hard for a GEC.

Lectures not mandatory to attend.  But AVOID this class if you can. This professor says what is on the lecture notes he post on his website. Yet his homework is challenging as hardly any of the problems are from the notes. Way hard for a GEC.
An excellent professor with a funny sense of humor!

This class was ridiculously hard for any GEC. 55% avg on the midterm, which doesn't factor in zeros. This was quantum physics with a prereq of Math 075 and NO SCIENCE/PHYSICS. Except, I don't think he got that memo. Show up to class everyday, read the book, get a C. I'm a senior and have never gotten below a B on ANY midterm.. ever..except this one

The pre-req was math 75 and its a GEC science course.  This guy had us deriving equations for theory of relativity and physics that even physics 133 provides up front. Class avg. for the first exam was a 55. Way too hard for a GEC. Lectures were useless as he provided no equations, nor did the "textbook" but somehow you had to figure them out.
Energetic teacher, clearly loves the subject.
Yeah, you had to go to class.  The tests were mediocre in difficulty, but he offered a bonus 3 pg paper worth 10%.  An easy A if you write the paper and do well on it.

I literally cannot express in words (appropriate for this site, anyway) how FRICKIN' TERRIBLE this class is and HOW MUCH Weinberg SUCKS as a professor.  I barely skated by with a C-.  He gives daily quizzes, doesn't explain notes very well, and keeps you until the VERY LAST SECOND of class.  Avoid him!!!!

This is the worst class I've ever had.  This class prevented me from making the dean's list for the first time ever at OSU.  The class average was a 6/10 on his quizes.  The midterm average was 68%.  DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS IF YOU CAN AVOID IT.  He is boring, doesn't use a microphone (in a large auditorium), and takes gives daily quizes (4 attendance

Ratings.comment: He is one of the nicest prof's I've ever had at OSU. He is really helpful if you go to his office hours. You can tell how passionate he is on the subject. He gives multiple choice questions during the lecture (not for a grade) to make sure we understand everything, it's a good checkpoint. He takes attendance sometimes. Study hard but it's worth it

He's SOO CUte like a little teddy bear. But seriously, this class was really interesting. The lectures were engaging and very cool. Grades are based mainly on four quizzes+final, which you probably will end up studying a solid amount for. Definitely not the easiest class ever (there were lessons that were pretty challenging), but still worth it imo
He's really passionate about his class, which definitely makes his lectures more enjoyable. You do have to pay attention if you want to do well though, but if you do, you should be good to go.
Prof Martini's lectures are really interesting and very clear. He is also extremely helpful and cares about students. I'd love to take another class of his.

if you have any basic interest in astronomy at all, he will make this an easy and interesting class for you. he's very clear, very helpful, and very interesting. it was an easy A for me and my buddies, and a perfect GEC. plus he tells jokes that are so bad they're good. highly recommended.

By far the hardest class I've taken in college, and I'm a junior. Completely unfair that this class is a GEC. You have a 50 point quiz every other Friday and then a cumulative final, as well as 4 homeworks which are purposefully harder than the material learned. Lectures are dry and hard to pay attention to, and you cover a new chapter everyday.
There was a lot of complex information for a 45 minute class.
This class is not easy, but the material is pretty cool and Prof. Martini's lectures are fairly clear.

It would be a terrible idea for anyone to take this class as a typical GEC. It takes entirely too much time and effort only for a mediocre grade. Multiple choice quizzes of 50 questions EVERY OTHER WEEK! Take geology for your science GEC if you want an easy A.
Quizzes are VERY hard. so is the hw. dont need the textbook. not a fan of the guy personally
Prof. Martini's 161 class is very dry.  He does not deviate from the online notes.  The quizzes are very, very tough.  I would reccommend not taking this class.

This guy covers WAY too much material.  Its a waste of time to go to class because he reads off the slides the whole time.  He knows his stuff though.  Its unfair that this class is a GEC requirement.

He's tough for sure. His "quizes" are a pain in the butt and he is not easy to follow in class at all. Unless you are genuinly interested in Astronomy and want to put a good amount of time into it, don't take this class.
Very passionate about Astronomy in a nerdy way. Class was kinda difficult with 4 multiple choice quizzes that had similar responses and the final was taken directly from them.

This guy is enthusiastic and clear, and he is very helpful if you go see him. The only downside is that he covers A LOT of material, but if you go to class and read the notes online the class is not too hard. I got a solid B without a lot of work.

If you paid attention in lecture, this was a fairly easy class. He put the notes up and jumbled them a bit to get the quiz questions. For homework sometimes it was best to just ask Google, but overall he was an enthusiastic and amusing teacher.

I went to class everyday, took notes, and ended up with Cs on everything. I agree with a previous poster that he is genuinely enthusiastic about the material-- so much so that he seems to expect us to share his enthusiasm when writing the homework and quiz questions.

The material is relatively easy; however, the his lectures are difficult to comprehend and his 'quizzes' (50 questions) are more difficult because of the wording he uses and the homework is a great deal more difficult than anything you will see on any test/quiz.
Explains topic well but covers a lot of material.  Willing to answer any questions and is very helpful.

An interesting class. He seems genuinely interested in the subject matter. He kept my attention throughout the quarter (which isn't easy). Not any easy A, but I recommend taking this class. You WILL learn something.

Ratings.comment: Professor Leroy is great at helping you understand things from the base level. I loved his lecture style; he would ask us questions throughout to keep us engaged, and the class was online, so the fact that this worked is surprising! Very friendly and helpful during office hours if you ever have any questions! Amazing prof! (& a fun + easy GE)

Adam Leroy is honestly a pretty good teacher who you can tell is genuinely excited to talk to his students about the material but doesnt expect everyone to have the same knowledge as he does. He is patient and willing to work with his students and is easy to contact. He tries to be close with his students and makes the information easy to learn.
Great lecturer. As long as you show up every once in a while and pay attention to the voting questions he gives you, you'll pass.
Had Mr. Adams twice. Great teacher! Willing to work with you before and after class to help you to get a better understanding. Also offers extra credit.
Verrry boring lectures, but as long as you read the lecture slides posted online youll pass the class

Prof Leroy is a great professor. He is super passionate about what he teaches, and is willing to help you outside of class. There is a lot of information and the tests are kind hard, but weekly homework helps your grade
This guy is awesome. Cool lectures, very knowledgeable, and easy class. I love how the course is set up.
He posts all of his slides and the lectures are boring and not mandatory so few people go, but if you do you'll get a chance to see some test questions early.

Prof. Leroy is chill, very knowledgeable and helpful outside of class. You don't need to go to every lecture because you can essentially study off the lecture slides for the exams. However, the way that the homework problems and exam questions are worded can be confusing. The homework can be difficult depending on how comfortable you are w/ math.

Adam knows his stuff. My only complaint was some questions on homework and tests were worded in a confusing way. His lectures are very interesting though, but not required to attend. If you do well on the tests, your bound to get an A or high B. Prepare to study hard for the test though, because it is a lot of info.

Professor Leroy is awesome! He's a intelligent guy and make the class attractive. Really inspirational lectures if you are interested in astronomy. Contents are broad but not deep. Homeworks(mostly simple calculations) are almost unrelated to the test and they're not hard for me. Study lecture slides earnestly then you can do well in exams.

Leroy is a straight up G.  Incredibly smart guy, with a Harvard degree, but also an amazingly good teacher.  Easy to follow, even on tough subjects, and tests are fast and straightforward.  Hardest part is the homework, but in turn he lets you work in groups and puts no math on the tests.  Book not needed, go to lecture or read slides- easy A.

A GE where homework are really tough. I did not expect them to be very hard. Quizzes and Exams are worded weirdly and confusing sometimes. Other than that, not bad of a professor. With the minimum effort and skipping class a lot, still managed a descent grade. Also, book is not needed at all.

This class is a lot harder than I expected.  It is a GE, but feels more like a class you take if you're majoring in astronomy.  The homeworks are really hard and aren't correlated with what you're learning in class.  The exams are quite difficult even if you study.  I would not recommend this class if you're looking for an easy science credit.

Adam is a really great guy and he is very smart. He knows what he is talking about and it shows in his lectures. The material was very interesting so I didn't have a problem going to class. The homeworks were very difficult, they had nothing to do with anything we were learning in the class. I don't recommended unless you're interested in it.

Adam was an extremely intelligent guy who instructed a really easy class. The class is very broad so most topics I already had background in. Lots of people skipped the class, including myself about 10 times, but lecture slides were posted. Don't make the same mistake I did and rent to textbook, we only used it to read one paragraph one time.
The guy's a genius. I attended almost all lectures, but you really don't need to. He puts the powerpoints online, which makes studying for the quizzes so much easier!

no essay, no short answer, but a lot of Qs. Lot of outside work (lot of HWs). He is genius ,but He talks really really fast, so if ur international student, dont take it unless ur english is really really good.  But as long as you study the slides you will get A I believe.

Professor Leroy gains his respect out of pure intellect. You can just tell this man is a genius. I went in to office hours to discuss the profession of "scientist" and his words were very helpful to me especially as I was considering switching majors. Go to office hours if you want to talk about anything at all. The class was cake.

Since I was taking a science gen-ed I really didn't expect too much, but the class wasn't too bad. Prof. Leroy is a nice guy and you can tell he knows quite a bit from what he may add to his lectures. Biggest complaint was that it was just so formulated. I eventually stopped going because you could just read the slides and pass the tests.
