Ratings.comment: Dr. Terndrup is truly an amazing person who cares about his students and will make himself available whenever someone needs him. He provides great feedback on all of the coding essays and is a very generous grader. He offers some extra credit as well and the assignments aren't too hard. They can just be a bit time consuming.
Dr. Terndrup is very nice. His lectures are wonderful and useful. The workload of the course is very reasonable. Recommend Donald!
Very solid professor. Choose Donald you will not regret!
He is a very solid professor. He makes the course very interesting. Anyone without a foundation in Astronomy and programming can really learn both Astronomy and Python!

Super kind and passionate guy who cares about his students. Very lenient with deadlines and always happy to help solve issues with code. I wish the course was a little more coding heavy because sometimes his lectures seemed unrelated to coding, but the assignments were a great introduction to Python. Learned a lot.

Donald was a great professor, I had already taken astrophysics courses before and signed up for his class in order to learn the python background on a familiar topic. The material in his class is so interesting that people who don't know astronomy can learn both astronomy and computer knowledge in his class.
Very solid professor

This class was really easy, you have a lot of time to do each project, theres a lot of extra credit (most people had over 100%), and there are no tests. He genuinely cares about his students and is very passionate about his job and general world issues. He's really good person and funny even though his lectures can be a bit boring.

Dr. Terndrup is amazing. Incredibly flexible with deadlines, and willing to make accommodations for students. Strives to make the field more inclusive for everyone. Would do anything for his students. Homeworks (weeklyish) do not take more than 5 hours. If class is falling behind he simply adjusts the deadline. Not a class to be worried about.

I took his first year seminar over various pseudosciences, he didn't have a set gameplan and would instead let the class take the discussion where we wanted. I learned a couple of astronomy things along the way as well.

Dr. Terndrup is a great professor. This class was hard considering I had never coded before, but he was really willing to sit down and help me. He loves the students that take an interest in astronomy and even offers research opportunities and scholarship help if you're lucky. Accessible, responds to emails quickly. Super nice and caring guy! 10/10

Dr. Terndrup is a good chicken nugget. He's interesting to talk to and the class was interesting. ASTRON1221 definitely needs more focus on coding, but i think he realizes that, and since he's interested in student input and opinions, i imagine the class will keep improving each semester it's around.

Extremely passionate, truly cares about astro and his students. we were graded based on 4 hws and 1 group project. Basically, if you do the homeworks you WILL get a good grade. Lectures are hard but mostly irrelevant to what you'll be graded on. The hws were hard but he'll basically give you the answers if you go to office hours. Very nice guy.

Professor Terndrup says at the beginning of the semester that you will pass the exams if you attend class- wrong. I went to every class and received a 62 on my first of three midterms. But, participation and the easy final paper were both 20% of the class and I ended up with a B+. "Fake it til you make it" really applies in this Cosmology class

Don't take this class with Prof Terndrup unless you are an astrophysics major. Material goes over everyone's head, and he doesn't slow down. Took as a GE and have to retake because he taught at a much higher level. Worst class ever.

So for a gen ed this class is so  easy. I swear I showed up day 1 and the 4 exams plus the final and got an A. I met with him once about making up an exam and he let me take it  in an office  by myself and did not check on me once. So if you blow an exam try to take a make up for a grade booster. I also had to write a paper on Galaxy Quest.

Had him for upper level astro class. Good lectures, nice, makes it clear he is willing to help. I'm lazier than I should be, and I decided I wanted to make the class count. He helped me all along the way, but I spent a lot of hours on homework and went to office hours. All around cool guy, would recommend.

If you attend lecture and study the notes he puts on Carmen, this class should be a breeze! The final was optional if you wanted to replace a midterm, and there was some extra credit available as well.

Professor Terndrup is a good astronomy teacher.  He explains the concepts well and gives many opportunities for questions.  If you pay attention and go to office hours, you should get a good grade. However, the preachy pop-feminism and environmental doomsday he's always bringing up can get annoying.

I think Terndrup was awesome. The class was really hard, but its college, get use to it. Some advice, go to his office hours and he will basically give you the answers. As long as you show Terndrup that you are trying you will get a good grade. And plus, he cant give out bad grades because it just makes him look bad! My 161 teacher was a lot worse!

Terndrup is TOUGH but the class is not impossible.  HW is the best cushion for your grade (40%) so make sure you put effort into it.  The midterms were challenging, but nothing surprised me and the final was easy.  Only take this class if you're willing to WORK HARD for your grade.

Often is in a bad mood. Likes to make his political views known and will let you know how usefel he thinks God is! Overall though, his class is not too difficult. Homework will help your grade. He can be a little picky on grading tests, but does not test over a majority of the material.

Good to see Terndrup's kids posted reviews here (the only two good ones). The people talking about what a nightmare this class is are absolutely right. He teaches astrophysics and is nitpicky as Hell on exams. I had friends that got A's in AST 161 look at my tests and their jaws drop. Stay away from this guy.

There is something seriously wrong with this professor. He spent 2 days talking about global warming alarmism and a day and a half talking about evolution. He needs to focus on the curriculum. He nitpicks every detail from grammar to any misspelling. Worst classroom experience I've ever had, the guy is just unprofessional, biased and rude.

OK...I don't know what all these negative reviews are talking about. This was a fairly easy class as long as you looked over the notes. I didn't even go to lecture, I just read through the notes and did just fine. He was a very fair teacher as long as you took the time to talk to him. I liked the class and thought he was a very good professor!

Ignore everyone below me.  This class is simple if you just go to the lectures (or if you dont).  He just hammers 1% of the material into your head and thats exactly what's on the midterms.  Go to class, do the HW, and you can get an A-B.

What horrible class. I've never been this angry with a class in my time at OSU. His homeworks are astrophysics, not astronomy and he doesn't cover the stuff anywhere near enough in class. He is no help. I hope you have taken lots of math and physics before you take 161 with Terndrup, otherwise you're screwed. Take this class with ANYONE else!

This class is mislabeled, it needs to be remarked Astrophysics 800. This is the hardest class I've ever taken at OSU and the professor is completely unhelpful. The people giving this class good ratings on here must be related to him, avoid this class like the plague!

He is genuinely interested in helping students, but teaches the class as if it's a 600 lvl class. I expected to work hard from the get go, but this is by far the most challenging class I have had at OSU (graduating in sp08). You will learn a lot in this class, but will definitely have to put in a great deal of work to get even close to an A.

i love this class.  one of my favorite classes in my college career (4 yrs), and I'm a psych major!  Homework can be challenging but he will be able to answer any questions you have in class.  Tests are short answer, and if you review your homework and study  guide you will easily be able to get a B+.  Great guy! Interesting! Awesome class!

Makes some funny jokes occasionally. Explains information in great detail and makes sure his students understand. Tests aren't terribly hard and the homework is easy, as long as you pay attention to the notes.  He posts copies of his notes online and it is very easy to understand.  Overall, the class is pretty good and it good for a sequence course

Tough class, the teacher doesn't believe in multiple choice anything. 6 homeworks, all short answer (some pretty tough), and 4 tests (most questions were easier than the homeworks). Expect to work hard and actually learn.

i think this guy must have changed or else 162 is just alot worse than 161 with him because this class is pure hell. the last two comments say it all. this is the worst class ever. he expects us to do astrophysics. astronomy majors don't even TAKE this class its supposed to be that basic. not so with this teacher.

This guy is a joke! I can't believe people were rating him good on here! I took him just because the ratings were so high on here, and I end up dropping the class. It was ridiculously hard, with homework that he never talked about in class, that were complex astrophysics, and tests with material on them that we NEVER went over! BAD!

This class is ridiculous.  I chose this to fulfill my Physical Science GEC because of the good ratings.  The professor yells at students in class for using their laptops, looking at their cells, or doing anything but sitting there.  He assigns homework with insane formulas to use, class is not CLEAR at all, tests are all extended response. RUN AWAY

This is one of the hardest classes I have ever taken in 5 years at OSU. Bar none. I took this class to fulfill a science GEC mostly based on reading the reviews here that said it was easy. Those people are either chronic liars or hold a doctorate in Astrophysics. Stay far far away from this class unless you like headaches and impossible material.
Great interaction with students, very clear

Very easy class.  Progessor was very clear, did not need the book at all if you went to lecture, keeps your attention and his office hours were extremely helpful.  I advise this class if you need a gpa boost
Great teacher. Office hours always helped. Graden on HW and exams. One of the best classes ever taken.
Go to class or just read the book, either way you should get an A. Homeworks are easy, exams are easy, and he's interesting in lecture... good class
I hardly went to class, and I got an A. He was a good lecturer, and his class is super easy.
Very helpful.  Always available for office hours.  Teaches the material clearly.
Very easy class.  Go to every class and submit the homework only after he has talked about it in class, and you'll get an A.  If you take decent notes, you probably won't even need the book.
Great prof.  easy hw goes over it in class before submission.  great class.

Interesting class. Some of the material was hard to grasp. But he does a good job teaching it. Go to lecture and keep up on reading and you should do fine. He is always around to help also. Midterms aren't too bad either. Also, he makes lecture entertaining, by making jokes, hes a cool geek and i love it! ha

For some reason I couldnt understand the material even though it was quite an interesting class.  Dr. Terndrup is a very helpful professor.  He sometimes makes weird stories that are corney but makes the class entertaining.  Cheat sheets were allowed on exams.  Take Astronomy with him!  He's really nice!

The material is harder than I expected it to be. The class is based more around concepts than statistics; expect to understand ideas rather than memorize/regurgitate facts. I'm not going to lie; I felt relieved when the class was over but it's a good way to fulfill that GEC.
Good teacher, stay on top of your reading and homework and it should be easy.
This class was hard!
fun class. willing to help with anything.
Fun class, very helpful prof.  The class really rewards effort - don't fall behind.
good way to fulfill physical sciences GEC. very intersting class if you actually care about the universe/solar system etc. definitely much better than bio/chem/physics. funny guy too.

The class is boring like the others said, but it is pretty easy, all tests are online and homeworks are online. If you do the reading and look at notes online it is not a problem missing class. The material is not too in depth, overall its an average class.

Although the class is very hard, he was a joy to have as a professor.  He's very nice and a self-proclaimed dork.  If you go to him and ask him questions and he sees that you are making an effort, he does his best to help you out.

Lectues are boring, but you have to go or you'll find behind. Some of it's interesting, but like other ppl said on here the questions to the hw or midterms are kinda tricky. BUT (at least my class) all the hw's and 3midterms were online! so u could look stuff up! final's in the classroom though.
Thought you would do the homework right and its wrong, the questions on the test are tricky
he knows what he's talking about and he's pretty amusing.
He is REALLY into what he does, but the class was really boring. On the other hand, it was better than Chemistry or Biology!
No Comments
Good teacher, knows what he is talking about. Dumbs down the material somewhat to make the class easy for some people in the class. Don't skip class, because you will fall behind.
No Comments
I learned absolutely nothing in this guy's class. I don't think he understood the subject well enough to be teaching it to others.
No Comments

Ratings.comment:
"What is your favorite black hole?" "Probably the one I discovered" 

I aspire to be that cool one day.

That's it. Dude was amazing.

I loved attending Todd Thompson's lectures and he made the class I didn't think I wanted anything to do with interesting to attend. Event though the class had a lot of work, Thompson was helpful in answering any questions he could and going above and beyond to make sure his students succeeded.

Todd is a really great guy, and he's way too qualified for this class. If you care about astronomy, you'll love this class. If you don't, please don't take it as a GENED. The work load is easy but is super time consuming kind of annoying. This is a good class, but a lot of kids get tricked into thinking it'll be an easy science. It isn't.

Super funny and makes lectures interesting! Material is going to be a bit challenging, but he makes it easy to understand and is really helpful outside of class. He also totally understands life situations happen and is lenient as long as you communicate. I wish I had room in my schedule to take him again!

Dr. Thompson has very engaging and interesting lectures. Unfortunately I found that the weekly assessments either did not relate to lecture or were on a much deeper level than what was covered in lecture. Labs are very easy and the professor is very lenient about life situations happening making you not able to turn something in.

Todd is awesome. Lecture material is confusing but he definitely knows what he's talking about and does everything he can to get to you ask questions. Super fun professors, was a lot of work for a GE but worth getting it done if you don't like science as the lab is all discussions based.
The best lecture I've ever been to.

Really nice guy who you can tell is more than knowledgeable with the material. He cares a lot about students asking questions and will wait long times for them to. Overall really fun prof who tries to bring joy and humor to his lessons. You can tell he knows what hes talking about.

Astronomy 1101 wasn't too bad. There are weekly lab assignments that took me an average of 15 minutes to finish, and that's the only homework. A lot of material is covered but none of it is too difficult - just a good amount of memorization. Todd is a clear lecturer, but in my opinion he was arrogant, which sometimes made him hard to listen to.

It becomes clear very quickly how overqualified Todd is to be teaching this class. Brilliant would be an understatement to describe him but he makes sure to make the lectures understandable. Tests can get a little detailed at times but very fair. Todd is a great lecturer and if you can get him for this class, do it.

I love this guy. He's hilarious and brilliant. Astronomy is not a generalized class so you have to pay close attention to understand some of the details but his lectures are definitely worth going to. He knows what he's doing and is motivated to help his students in any way that he can. I definitely recommend taking him for this course.

Great professor. The class is hard if you don't know a lot about astronomy, but todd is so helpful and always willing to help you out. The exams are hard but the final is easy if you work for it. Even though I didn't get a good grade, I would still take it again.

Todd is a great professor, he is super casual, even though it is obvious that he is a brilliant astrophysicist, he makes his lectures very easy to follow. He makes lots of jokes and is very very well spoken. My favorite part of his class is how he welcomes absolutely any random space question you could have ex. What if ...? Why does...? etc

He is so smart and passionate about his field. Some take home quizzes but he would really help you out if you email him or go to office hours. The 3 tests weren't too bad and he dropped your lowest one. Some physics equations were needed in class but nothing hard at all. Loved this class and Prof. Thompson!
Best professor

Very helpful in office hours. 3 homework, 4 quizzes-drop the lowest grade, 1 final. He takes attendance every class. The material can be a little boring, but study lecture notes and listen in class, you will be fine. Good professor compared to others.

This class was very hard. His test questions were very confusing and was hard to study for. Class notes were confusing and just a difficult class to understand if you are not sciencey. Also never used textbook so was a waste of money.
I had a different experience than others. I did not enjoy this class and struggled. This is heavily physics based.
Todd is a really good teacher. He really cares about students and he is helpful if you have questions. The final is easy and the quizzes aren't bad if you study.

I had Thompson for both 161 and 162. He was a great teacher. He kept his lectures interesting and created encouraged, but didn't demand, participation and discussion. He's very funny and cracks jokes throughout lectures. He grades class attendance so I would recommend choosing another teacher if you plan on skipping most days.

Fantastic teacher. He will answer any and all questions, regardless of relevance to the day's lecture. Encourages you to think beyond the material, which helps you understand the course material even more. I definitely recommend taking the class if you liked 161.

Professor Thompson is probably one of the smartest teachers I have had so far. He is enthusiastic about astronomy and very very knowledgeable about the field. I would absolutely recommend him if you are interested in any Astromoy class

So far at OSU Todd has been my favorite professor. He keeps the lectures very interesting and fun. He encourages you ask any questions you have and always gives good answers. He is a very fun and energetic teacher. You can tell that he is truely interested in the material and wants to teach it. He is truely a great professor!

Great professor! Like the other comments have said, I looked forward to attending his lectures. His grading/assignments are fair. Be sure to study previous HW for the quizzes, as material generally shows up. Follow along with the study guides he posts on the class website. Again, terrific professor, great guy all-around. I HIGHLY recommend him!

Attending lecture is key to doing well, but Todd tries to make lecture interesting (I actually wanted to go). He will answer any questions you ask about astronomy, including theoretical ones.  Probably the best professor I've had at OSU. Definitely take his class!
One of my favorite professors ever!! He's VERY helpful and tries his hardest to make the class interesting! Highly recommend!

One of my favorite instructors ever. Very nice guy, teaches the material very well. One of the more relevant classes I've taken. Attendance is required. You have to study a lot for the quizzes, but the material is not complicated.

Great professor! He's very interesting and energetic during classes, encourge asking questions. and he is literally trying to remember everyone's name. not only talk about the course material, actually you can ask him anything regarding astronomy-aliens, timetravel, etc. just study the lecture notes and u will be fine. no need book!

Todd was awesome. He is really enthusiastic, intelligent, and enjoys teaching. He was easy to understand and his lectures were interesting- I was actually disappointed if/when I couldn't attend class! Quizzes/homework weren't bad either as long as you study his lecture notes. Would recommend this class (taught by Todd) to everyone.

Thompson is truly a genius. I think he's too smart to teach this class, honestly. The material wasn't that hard though and if you just study the notes for the tests you should be fine and get a solid grade. I recommend going to class as well.
Let us ask questions, made astronomy very fun and interesting.  Very helpful and some of the quiz questions he put on the exam for easy points.

Ratings.comment: I had him in astron2895 and I feel like he really cares about his students. When he found out that our physics 1270 class had an in-person exam on election day, he messaged some higher ups to try and get the date changed. Always available for students and supports so many events like the theater program and star parties. I see the guy everywhere.
Wayne is a great, funny professor. The planetarium star shows are really cool, but the lab work is tough and youre required to work in groups.
He goes out of his way to help his students.

This is probably my least favorite class that I've ever taken.  It was online with hours of YouTube lectures.  Most of the class failed all the exams, but there is a tremendous curve.  The curve on our first exam was 22 points.

Goes extremely fast in lecture.  Is a lot less formal than preferred.  Tests are extremely difficult.  There was a group video project and lots of homework, which didn't contribute much to your overall grade.  He utilizes technology a lot for assignments, internet and cameras etc.  However he doesn't enter grades in until the end of the semester.

Wayne was a great lecturer who really cared if you achieved in his class. He was constantly offering additional help if needed and held extra review sessions before every test. He had discussion forums online so students could discuss and read other answersideas to class topics. He was extremely clear. He could have made it harder, but didn't.

Ratings.comment: Legend! Choose Mr. Gaudi, you will not regret!
Mr. Gaudi is a legend. I really learn a lot from his course and get an A with my effort!

Gaudi is an absolute legend. After I had taken his Astron 2291 before, I chose his course Astron 2292 again, his understanding of the knowledge was deep enough, and the explanation was very vivid. Problem Sets have a high correlation with exams and lectures.

Mr. Gaudi is a legend. His lecture was excellent and deep. Problem sets he assigned are challenging but not unsolvable. I took Mr. Gaudi's Astron 2291 in Autumn 2023 and got 91.28 (A-) as the original score, but I got an A after the curve. In the upcoming Astron 2292 course in Spring 2024, I will still firmly choose and highly recommend Mr. Gaudi!

Mr. Gaudi is a very solid professor. Astronomy is a difficult subject, but he made students understand such complex principles through meticulous blackboard writing and in-depth explanations. Most of the problem sets he assigned were difficult, but they could be solved with dedication. Highly recommend Mr. Gaudi!

I highly recommend Mr. Gaudi. He is a very learned and interesting man! Astronomy itself is a difficult course, but with Mr. Gaudi's explanation, it becomes vivid and easy to understand. I can say that Astronomy 2291 is not an easy A to earn, but Mr. Gaudi must be a very caring person and he must be a good choice!
Amazing professor with amazing lectures. Highly recommend Mr. Gaudi!

A very solid professor. His lecture is very well-organized and in depth. He also knows very deeply in Astronomy. As a student who never touched astronomy before, I got an A with the assistance of Dr. Gaudi!

He's great. Really appreciates students who take an interest in the course. He replies to emails very quickly, and was available outside of office hours and class for questions. He also listens to student feedback and takes it into account. All around a great professor!
Hes tedious.

This man is a legend. You should feel blessed to even have an opportunity to take his class. Odds are you will learn, laugh, and maybe not get the easiest A, but a good grade is more than doable. This man is greatness. Respect.
Awesome teach,  helped me out a lot, especially with me not being an astro major

I took this class instead of a classic biology/physics/chemistry during my senior year of high school. Despite mandatory attendance, showing up to lecture isn't necessary to do well. The topics were interesting and he was VERY knowledgable. It's because of this guy that switched to the astronomy major. As others said, he had a kickass beard.

Pretty easy and fun class if you make sure to make a good equation sheet for the tests.  There are only a few homework assignments so take time to do well on them. Gaudi is very passionate about astronomy and it shows. He and his beard are very inspirational to any aspiring astronomy student.

It's a really interesting class with a really interesting professor. He's one of my favorite professors in Ohio state. Exam will be very easy if you write down every formula on equation sheet. Homework will be easy as well if you go to class.

Very interested in teaching and helping students. He's funny as hell and rocks the facial hair like a real man. His homework assignments are pretty involved, but if you go to his office hours or email him he always helps out.

I really liked professor Gaudi, he was easy going and tried to make his class interesting. The class was challenging, but he was always willing to help in any way possible, including on exams. The homework sets were challenging, but an A is easy to obtain if you go to class and pay attention; want to add that he discovers planets, pretty sweet!

Ratings.comment: You can tell she actually cares about her subject and the quizzes are open internet and fairly easy.

Professor Johnson is a good professor who enjoys teaching Astronomy but does go quite fast during lectures. Taking notes during class is useless and I recommend to review her powerpoints before class. Also, the in class exercises are quite random and typically dont relate to the lecture. Four different books are required for HW quizzes.

I liked this class and professor but sis goes way too fast in lectures and you can't get all the notes. I disagree with others and would say that the exams aren't super straight forward. She is a good meaning person and super likable just this class at times doesn't all add up. The in-class exercises did not relate to the class at all also,,,

I would recommend Prof Johnson for ANY GE, especially 1141. The class is an easy A as long as you show up (slides never posted online). She always tells you what will be on quizzes, will help with online HW questions (literally give answers) if you go to office hours, and drops lowest quizzes. She's also really passionate about the topics. 5/5!

weekly homework usually based around the book ur reading at the time. While the books aren't necessary I would recommend reading them since they'll boost your HW grades. Quizzes (as she calls them) are ridiculously easy as long as you go to lecture. Attendance is important bc she does daily in-class papers and the missing points can/will add up

Easy GE. Show up to 80% of classes to do the in class activity and get 100% on participation. Homework worth 32% of your grade, but two lowest grades dropped. Three quizzes and a final. Either 2 quizzes counted and final worth 30%, or 3 quizzes counted and final worth 20%. Tells you what to take note of for the quizzes a couple of days before quiz.

Dr. Johnson is extremely nice and is totally willing to work with you and schedule office hours with you if you can't make it to hers. The lectures are a bit disorganized and hard to follow, though, and the homework is much harder than what you do in class. If you go to office hours though she'll help you with the hw and basically give you answers.

Professor Johnson is a very nice person, but is extremely scattered/disorganized. In terms of the class itself, I was quite disappointed as 80% of the content dealt with geology/biology, not astronomy. Her homework questions were frustrating since her answer choices were purposefully deceptive. Nonetheless, the class was fairly easy. 5 pts of EC.

Dr. Johnson wasn't so bad, but I do think she could have focused more on clarity rather than content; the lectures were quite disorganized. She seems like a nice enough person, but I wish she hadn't discussed politics at allthat made it awkward at times. Just try to understand concepts and you'll be fine, but you'll mostly learn random facts.

She's very sweet and eccentric-- everything you'd expect from an astronomy professor. Lectures can get a little boring but planetarium visits are really cool. Her study guides were thorough and she posted all the notes for each lecture.
She was cool, class was usually very interesting. It's not a super easy class, but worth taking. She was usually late, but ended class on time.

Great teacher. Always willing to help. Gives so many opportunities to get good grades (easy participation points, answers questions via email, drops lowest exam, and gives all questions that may be on exam). Only have to be at  2/3 of the classes for participation points. Notes online.  If you study the study guide, you'll get an A on every test.

Professor Johnson is very passionate about Astronomy but if you don't share that interest be prepared to struggle. The lectures and homework are very much physics based and if you don't have a background there the homework become very difficult. Was not what I expected for a GE credit.

3 homeworks (100 points each), 4 30-question multiple choice quizzes, 15 easy in-class exercises, and a final. Very passionate and knowledgable about Astronomy, which can lead to occasional confusion and very long lectures. But she always sees if we have questions and makes herself available. Would recommend, just use office hours for homeworks.

DO NOT GET TEXTBOOK, she posts all lectures online. She has very good study guides, easy tests, they get harder by the end. Offers a lot of extra credit. If you are comfortable with basic biology, chemistry, and physics like me, it is more of a review of basics but applied to the solar system. The Homework was very difficult hardest part of class

Does not allow laptops, phones, or any other electronics in class under any circumstances.  If she sees it she will call you out in class and everyone will laugh at you.  Drops your lowest quiz and homework grade.  Attendance optional, just show up for tests and pick upturn in bi-weekly homework packets.

The thing about her class is that the tests (multiple choice) are super easy, but the assignment she gives take work and she's very thorough with grading them, so you have to actually do those well. Overall, if you pay attention and do the assignments, it's totally fine.

She was very very knowledgable and clearly loves what she teaches, that being said she was very very confusing and frankly I had no idea what she was saying half the time. If you don't have a physics background the second half of the course will just be impossible. Thank God the first half was super easy.

Jennifer seems brilliant in the astronomical field & almost too much so for a gen ed class. While she is nice and helpful, her notes that she provides are unclear. The content is tough to grasp without some sort of physics background. Do well in the beginning of the course as the material is easier and gets much much more difficult towards the end.

Professor Johnson is very passionate and knowledgable about what she teaches. She is approachable and helpful and answers emails in a timely manner. However, this class involves a lot of discipline and study, as it is very challenging. Professor says that she makes tests so that no one could get a perfect score... You need to attend every class!

Professor Johnson was AWESOME! I attended every lecture and was not disappointed. If you paid attention, her humor made the class better. Although you have to print out the notes for this class, Prof J wants her students to succeed, and I loved that about her. I wish I could have her for another astronomy course in the future!

One of the best professors I've ever had and it was just a GEC course. I've learned an incredible amount and she is just so knowledgeable/informative. The course was challenging but attending lectures and trying hard ensures a good grade. She also happens to be very witty and makes everything, even the most boring minutiae, absolutely fascinating.

It's hard to say. I am enjoying the course but I happen to have solid algebra skills. She lectures well and clearly has an interest in the topic. For the homeworks, you may do well to brush up on your basic algebra and unit conversion skills. The tests themselves have almost no math whatsoever.
For a GEC, she expects a lot on her tests and homework sets.  Very hard class, she lectures fast, and does not come of as approachable at all.  I recommend to avoid if possible!

She tries hard. Somewhat unclear. Very strict. Says some really random stuff. You HAVE to pay attention to understand what she is saying. Doesn't enjoy the use of a bra(positive/negative?). Only had her half a semester, was really weird. She loves astronomy though. Willing to help, just gotta ask. Not always clear in class. Problem sets are hard.

Johnson tries really hard to be clear in her lectures and allow her students to understand complex concepts. Her lecture notes are always clear and follow the lectures. Science is hard for me, so I enjoyed going to her class because she taught in a way that I could understand.

Very knowledgeable instructor and very passionate about the field of Astronomy. I had a slight interest in the stars, and she made the learning experience fun. Not afraid to present her point of view on political issues in the field of Astro in class. Book not needed. She gives great notes, but study is required to understand exams. Recommend

For a non-major GEC class Johnson takes it peculiarly serious. Has multiple tangents each lecture (none relevant), unclear expectations, hard exams, and seems to go off her whims for exams rather than the book or lecture notes (which you'd assume would help, right?). Avoid her like the plague, your GPA and interest in science will thank you.
Great professor, very very helpful if you ask. Recommend!

Prof. Johnson explains the material very clearly and if you don't understand the information she tries her best to help you. She is very knowledgeable about astronomy and her lectures are as interesting as an astronomy lecture could be. I generally don't like science, but she makes the class interesting. I would highly recommend her.

SHE IS TERRIBLE! do not take her- EVER! she talks wayy too fast and has impossible tests. She is the worst grader in the world and is completely unfair. Hardest grader ever. Very unfair. DO NOT TAKE HER!!!

Jennifer was very enthusiastic about astronomy, which should be a given among college professors but not necessarily always is. She was extremely knowledgable and extended herself to students at every corner when they needed help. If you're the type who works hard, you'll be fine, and if you don't it is fairly easy. small workload, att. optional
YIKES! Prepare to be compelled to jam a pencil in your eye to feel something other than the intense boredom that is this class.  Only take this class w/ Prof. Johnson if you learn best in your sleep.

I enjoyed this class more than any science class I've ever taken. Professor Johnson was clear, and presented the material like an expert, though made it perfectly understanding. Her powerpoints contained excellent visualizations, and her out of class assistance was superb. EXCELLENT PROFESSOR

There are PODCASTs of this class by Prof POGGE that REALLY HELP and are BRILLIANT and INTERESTING.  just Google: Pogge OSU.  The exams and homework were horrible. There was a huge curve on the exams and if you went to her office hours she would help you with the homework and give you the answers.
One of those teachers who teaches the class as if everyone is majoring in Astronomy.
Horrible, do not take.  Talks way too fast, too much info on slides, learned nothing.  Had midterm the day before the michigan game...enough said.

Her class makes you really tired...she just talks an has the lights way down...she has about 12 pages of notes per lecture and doesnt give you a study guide for exams...huge curve on the midterm, but still a hard class...you dont really learn much, but just luck out with the curve
No Comments

Ratings.comment: Deploy makes his lectures funny and relatable. He has us go to star parties hosted by the Astro department for an extra point to be added to the end of your grade for every party you attend. His lectures follow the outlines he posts but you need to hear the lecture to clarify. He posts reviews for every test. His final is all the old tests

Great prof... doesn't require the text, and you don't need it if you actually go to class... he puts slides online, so you don't even have to write much down during class if you print them... learn the major concepts and you'll get at least a B, if not higher... this is astronomy, so it's not a lazy class... however, it WILL teach you something
Not a skilled teacher. Makes class way to hard for a GEC. I want to be a preschool teacher, not a scientist so I don't see why this class needs to be that difficult
Confusing class. study guides not helpful. wish he would put more effort into teaching
he is a great guy but his german accent is hard to understand
Great professor! It is very easy to get an A. He will drop the lowest homework and the midterm points. And the attendance is not mandatory. Take his class!

He is a very nice guy. Very laid back, homework can be turned in late and still receive full credit. Only used the book for the homework. The answers are right out of it. Exams are not bad at all, just study the practice exams online and look over eye class notes and you can get a good grade with no problem.

He's has a German accent and a monotone which can be difficult to understand and makes you want to sleep in class. BUT - he's very nice and helpful , just go up and ask him quetions during exams and he WILL help you. The class isn't easy b/c the questions on exam are pretty random. He does give extra points so so them! and drops lowest quiz & exam

All around fun professor. The accent is hard to pick up for the first few days but you get used to it. The tests are hard and contain material not covered in the lecture but that's the way it is for EVERY Astronomy class. If you're going to take an astronomy class you might as well like your professor, right? Take Dietrich.

He is a great guy, not a great teacher. quite humorous too. Drops lowest of the homework assignments,and tests.English isnt his first language, so hard to understand at times. VERY helpful, even in times of tests. definitely not an easy A, esp if you dont go to lectures. Overall, very good professor!

great guy not a great teacher. has pages of notes for each lecture, you basically memorize them thinking you're sure to do well, and then the questions on the tests are about subjects that were not in the notes nor discussed in class. my advice is if u care more about learning & doing well than hearing someone be cute &tell jokes, dont take w/ him.

As someone else mentioned, he is adorable. He is really excited about the class and tells quirky little jokes (and laughs at them himself). As far as the class goes, the book isn't necessary. He has printable notes up on Carmen, which help to decipher his German accent.

He is a great teacher his native language is German so hes difficult to understand at times. His exams arent bad if u study he posts all his exam reviews online and his lecture notes. He gives u a chance to get 5% xtra cred. toward final grade, just go to a planetarium show for 40 mins each one =s 1%. I would reccomend him very enjoyable!

He is so adorable! I wouldn't go to class if it wasn't for his enthusiasm (which is helpful at 9:30!) You can't quite understand him, but his notes are online so it doesn't matter. He has a great sense of humor and wears adorable sweaters in the winter, and, he's fairly prompt with E-mail if you have any questions!
good class. the teacher is very inthusiastic, nice and aproachable
He is hard to understand but he genuinely likes what he is teaching and if you study for the tests they are pretty easy.

It's a little difficult to understand him at first because English is not his first language, but if you hang in there, you can start to decipher him better and better.  He's really enthusiastic about the subject matter, and I really enjoyed the class.

He is awful do NOT take him. You can't understand a word he says. So far, the class average on exams are D's. There a four exams and a final. I don't even go to class anymore, and have my study my butt off from the book and his notes online. It's possible to get a good grade, but it's so not worth it for a GEC.

Does not explain things well. Test are on more than he lectures. He says you do not need the book but it might be helpful since his slides are not. You are allowed cheat sheets for the exams but they are not helpful. Only 3 midterm and a final. The grading scale is based off of the class which can be good or bad. Boring lectures as well.

Nice guy, but a terrible professor. Is not very clear and is very unorganized. Also has terrible handwriting. Homeworks were easy, but don't bother studying for the exams, since they have nothing to do with what he actually teaches in class or puts on the homework.
Really enjoyed this class & I thought it would be an absolute bore. Rather funny & has good humor. Didn't attend class much, lectures were online. Memorize the notes & you should be able to do well!
Cool guy. He's hard to understand at first, (I thought RR Lyrae stars were El-Eye-Ray stars for half the quarter) but incredibly knowledgeable and funny to boot. Pretty easy going about most things.
Excellent professor, very interesting. You don't really need the book,but it might help a little. He is very funny and the class was fun.

His tests definitely related to the material, it just wasn't your standard "repeating facts" type of test.  The tests take the notes from the lectures (in Power Point format, posted on the web) and applies that knowledge.  If you study the notes, you should do fine on the tests.  I recommend actually going to class and handwriting the notes.

I have no idea where he got his exam material..I attended every lecture and the midterm questions were not from those lectures. Never referred to the book whatso ever. Entertaining and nice man but was not happy with how the exams went.
He was awesome

I disagree with the previous comments...I did great in his class by studying his powerpoint presentations.  And his accent was never a problem, with the exception of the word "develope", but that was just funny.  And you could usually count on him for a random joke comment.  I'd recommend his class.
Great professor. Explains things very well. Tests contain no math, all conceptual. Tests are difficult, be he uses a curve. Final exam is 75% old midterms. Makes subtle humorous comments.
Hard Exams!

He has an accent :-/ Yes his tests are ridiculously hard and barely match his lectures.  The final is what saved me because it was 75% same questions as on the other tests so I just memorized all the answers.  He does curve ridiculously, but that's the problem is you never know what your gonna get...I'm usually straight A's and I got a B-

His lectures are powerpoint slides. He is very difficult because his lectures dont really relate to the test. There is 3 test and one final. The three test are really hard because he twist words around to make you miss questions. final is easy. I reccomend David ennis for 161 and 162 becasue he's awesome and a better teacher

such an interesting class, i hate to say that its hard, but it really is. the great thing about stanek was the curve he gave. the tests were so hard, i failed every one of them (except the final b/c its based on the old midterms), and i ended up with a C+. an F to a C+ is a ridiculous curve. I recommend the class, just read the book.
very funny
fun guy, really interesting class but his tests weren't the easiest.  he does curve though and from what he said it will be pretty generous.

Though he is a really good guy, his lectures are unclear. He overexplains a concept too many different ways, and it leaves most of the class confused. The midterms are not based anything on the powerpoints despite the fact that they are supposed to be. Friends from other 161 sections cannot believe our tests difficulty.
First class taught.  Did not have a well-defined structure and the homework took forever.  The first midterm was basic plugging into formulas and changing units.  Final was formulas and material.

I was also in his first class- the material wasn't usually presented in a way that was effective to me. The HW was sometimes taken from a previous prof, and was frustrating/very tedious. The TA often had better ways of explaining concepts on the HWs.  It was sometimes hard to understand him, but for his first time teaching the course, he was OK.

I was in his first class teaching at OSU. His midterm was based on calculations(med to hard), his final was calculations/qualitative questions (med to hard), HW (med to hard). He gave extra credit opprotunities. He didn't structure the class in the best way (giving relevant info), but he cared about teaching. He could improve/change next year tho.

I remember Professor Gene Capriotti from the class I took in 1976. He started each class with a stand up routine. He told great stories about the people who defined modern astronomy. He had a skill for explaining difficult concepts, like the dual wave/particle nature of light, in a manner that non-scientists could comprehend. Best.

I had the pleasure of having Dr Capriotti for Astro 101 back in the summer of 1997. 20 years later, I can still recall how fascinating his lectures were. Literally made astronomy come alive. Scholarly, yet at the same time engaging and approachable. Not a hint of condescension shown to humanities majors. If only more professors had his gifts!

The best professor/teacher I've ever had. And the best class l ever took. Interesting, educational (of course), and a lot of fun. More available than not, approachable, totally helpful and always in good humor. Definitely added fun and enthusiasm to my education. A great guy.
Coolest professor I ever had

Best class I ever took. Best teacher I ever had. There was no book, just lecture. Advanced topics in Astronomy without the math. Great passion for the subject, great sense of humor. I still have cassettes of some of the lectures. His passion became my passion.
I remember him after 33 year--well enough to Google him.  It was a great class.

Dr. Capriotti @ O.S.U. was one of if not the best prof. I've ever had.  He was brilliant in that he made complex issues seem simple.  He has a great sense of humor and was always cracking us up.  I knew he was OK when I bumped into him at a sports bar on NFL Sunday. Anyway, to this day I still love astronomy because of him.
definitely knew his stuff, but quizzes were definitely hard, one of those classes that you might have to skim the reading to comprehend what he's actually talking about
uninteresting subject matter but presented well and always ready for help when needed. i enjoyed the stories, they keep the course interesting.

He is a great teacher who REALLY knows what he's talking about, and will do anything to help. I can't believe the people who say he goes off on tangents. Every story he tells is awesome, and really shows his experience. The material is really interesting, and anyone who disagrees is just stupid.
the class was hard... but it wasnt because of him. The material sucked, but he went over it well. Not an easy course, but he will help you so much. Nice guy, too bad he is retiring! Great professor!
Sometimes he's a bit confusing, but he's friggin hilarious and pretty easy to get ahold of if you need help

Professor attempted to make jokes, but wasnt at all funny.  He randomly went off on tangents that had nothing to do with the subject, just making things more confusing. Wasnt clear when explaining and office hours didn't help AT ALL.  Pop quizes were NOT EASY.  DONT DO IT!
No Comments

I really liked this guy because he was funny and he knew his stuff.  The quizzes were tough but the final was half the grade and it was exactly like the quizzes so it was cake.  I reccomend the professor and the class.

i absolutely loved this class! He was such a great teacher. And even though he gave pop quizzes, half the time he told you exactly what they were on and when they were going to be. I recommend him as a teacher to anyone else!

I hate this teacher. He goes off on random tangents all the time and makes terrible jokes as a poor attempt to relate to his students. He gave us 10 pop quizzes that counted as half of our grade. He was boring. It's really hard to prepare for his class because of the pop quizzes. DONT TAKE HIS CLASS

I was in his first ever class and you could tell he was a new professor. He's a really nice guy and will be a great professor eventually. He did get a little flustered that no one ever went to lecture but it was because the class really wasn't very difficult. If you study you will do fine. Overall, he was helpful but struggled teaching sometimes.
